name: La Suite West

reviews.title: 'Small Stylish Stay'
reviews.text: Had a 2 night stay in this boutique hotel to bring in the new year.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff were friendly and welcoming, and happily provided maps and information. The room was stylish however the size was extremely small, I appreciate the minimalist theme but 2 people in a double room was cramped, this is the only thing that lets this place down. Apart from the size the room was very tasteful and most importantly, clean. The bathroom in my opinion exceeded the room, loved the marble floor and walls, good size in comparison to the bedroom, great touch were the complimentary toiletries.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a good central position
Chic hotel, good location
reviews.text: What a lovely surprise, the hotel was clean and very warm on a cold April day,especially the heated floor in the bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are very comfortable and the full english breakfast, pastries, toast and freshly squeezed orange juice was more than I could manage. The staff were very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Nice Bayswater Base

reviews.text: We would be happy to return again
reviews.title: Top Hotel & Service!
Stylish Hotel Near Notting Hill
reviews.text: If you're looking for a stylish boutique hotel near Notting Hill, then you can't do any better than to book at La Suite West. The Terrace Suite was a fantastic choice. With a key to your own courtyard, it felt like coming home to a private apartment. The bathroom was one of the largest I've ever seen in a London hotel and the bed was absolutely perfect. The location is ideal. Close to Westbourne Grove, a short walk to Kensington Gardens and with literally a 2 minute walk to the Queensway or Bayswater Tube stations, you can be anywhere in London easily. The staff was tremendously kind, always welcoming and accommodating.

reviews.title: A Disappointment.
reviews.text: My wife and I checked in to one of their Terrace suites, which are advertised as larger suites with a small terrace and a gate that leads out to the street. What they don’t tell you is that it is so close to the street that the noise from the traffic and the endless noisy B & B’s that line the street, is so loud that you can’t sleep. A little double-glazing on the door and window panes might’ve helped, but it obviously wasn’t in Ms. Hempel’s budget!.

reviews.title: Good Location, Tiny Room
reviews.text: We ended up being moved into their Notting Hill suite at the back of the building, which turned out to be much quieter. But none of the rooms have king size beds which is a big no-no for me.

reviews.title: Very nice, clean and modern, in a great location
reviews.text: The restaurant at LA Suite west is outstanding, everything from the beautiful breakfast to dinner, was worthy of any fine establishment. They have a wonderful healthy menu that includes vegetarian and alkaline dishes for people on that diet.

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: But this hotel tries too hard. It doesn’t quite fit into the high-end “boutique” category that it seems to try and want to be a part of. For one thing the level of inconsistency regarding the maid service is annoying. Every day they missed something, either not replacing the water (which happened most days) and mini bar items, to leaving dirty cups and glasses from the night before. Mixing up the lotion and conditioner bottles so one ends up washing ones hair with body lotion. The bathroom door didn’t slide properly, the heating under the floor of the bathroom is too hot and burns your feet, and apart from the doormen, the staff in the restaurant and the manager that helped us move, everyone was passive aggressive in their treatment of us.
We booked four nights through Last Minute Secret Hotels (where the identity of the hotel is revealed only after you pay). Big mistake. One never to be repeated.
reviews.title: We loved it so much we paid for 4 nights and stayed for 2.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the interests of fairness, let's start with the positives. They won't take too long:
reviews.title: glorified prison

reviews.text: -The internet is free and works wonderfully well.
reviews.title: Quite the nice hotel

reviews.text: -The showers are very un-English in that you get a good blast of hot water rather than a tepid trickle of lukewarm (I'm English - I'm allowed to say such things).
reviews.title: Very nice and comfortable hotel

reviews.text: -The staff were always polite and willing to help - and by the end we could have been categorised as 'difficult' guests.
reviews.title: Good but not great

reviews.text: I spent HOURS researching hotels in London, my friend and I agreed to book the Hyde Park Twin Room - paid in advance on 3 March 2013 for a 26-28 April 2013 stay. We arrived ~1.5 hrs before check-in time & were told there were no twin bedded rooms left. I understand things happen, but when asked if we really needed separate beds, I responded a quizzical "I guess not" because I really wasn't sure what my answer was supposed to be. My friend & I are not a couple & obviously wanted different beds which is why we were booked that room in advance - a good month & a half in advance. The woman also mentioned that she would have to speak with her boss, but said they might just upgrade us because of the inconvenience. My friend returned to the hotel before I did, to find our bags had been brought to our room (#38), a double-bedded room that barely fit us, let alone our bags. When we returned from dinner, we spoke with Ava, explained the situation, for which she was quite apologetic, & switched us to room 21, which definitely gave us more room. I am extremely thankful for people like her - her kind intentions were greatly appreciated (she even came back to the room with another person to pull out and make the bed). The next day, when arriving back to the room late afternoon, we noticed most of our belongings were re-arranged or moved. The make-up I left in the bar area, was moved; clothing hanging in the closet were taken out & left on the chair by the door; all of our toiletries in the bathroom left on the counter were IN the sink; my friend's ruck sack in the bedside table drawer, was removed & put on top of my suitcase on the table by the door. Sadly, this was my last hotel stay of a 17-day trip around Europe & it left a sour taste in my mouth, so to speak. In room 21, the rug was SO uncomfortable I had to wear shoes - they did provide flip-flops/tongs, but they were enormous. The bathroom was the best, with a heated marble floor, but the shower glass partition was quite short in length, soaking most of the bathroom; even my friend who's British was surprised. The fold out couch/bed was EXTREMELY uncomfortable - it was not straight across - there was a huge dip going down the middle; a staff member should lay down on this and test it out; but the bedding was nice. The idea of the aesthetics of the hotel is a good idea, as is the small boutique hotel feel, private outdoor area & fabulously convenient location (1 block from the Bayswater tube stop & 2 blocks from Kensington Gardens). The biggest disappointment is that I have yet to get a reply from the hotel's General Manager whom I emailed May 4th (it's been 9 days).
reviews.title: Nice boutique hotel in theory

reviews.text: La Suite West is very handy for Central London - only a few stops on a bus away from Oxford Street and only 100 yards from Hyde Park. Staff very friendly and efficient. Breakfast was excellent - freshly cooked - good choice. Decor very modern. Only one drawback was that the rooms were a little small, but they were well equipped with robes, slippers, good toiletries, heated bathroom floors, "proper" coffee, magazines and a flat screen television.
reviews.title: something different

reviews.text: great rooms and helpful staff. we will definitely come again. we loved the bathroom, with the lovely toiletries and thick towels. great selection of tea and magazines, and comfortable bed. we stayed 4 nights in a inverness suite, that comfortably accommodated 2 adults and a teenager.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here last month.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.text: On entry it seemed a bit on the dark side but putting that aside.
reviews.title: A touch of the eastern

description: London's newest luxury boutique hotel.Located on a quiet street on the edge of London's magnificent Hyde Park and close to the West End and Paddington, is the minimalist and latest creation of famed British designer Anouska Hempel.Ranked one of the world’s top 100 interior designers and architects, Anouska Hempel has also made a name for herself in landscape design and high fashion and has owned, designed, and managed several award-winning, luxury boutique hotels.Here at La Suite West, the aesthetic takes the shape of a stark temple of black and white, where clean lines meet sharp angles and sculptural forms. A corridor of inky-black marble floors leads guests up to an unusually long white marble reception desk.In the garden, crisp lines and sculptural forms that characterise the hotels interior are echoed in meticulously pruned plants, trees and hedges. Leading from the hotel restaurant, food and beverage service is available, making it the perfect location for cocktails or afternoon tea.
